result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Kenneth E Banks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Kenneth E Banks.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. JSH. Defn request plea/sentencing. Will be filing letter today withdrawing speedy trial demand, removing trial dates. State has no position.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling

Jury status hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty Jacob Idlas
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant must provide proof of employment to DCPS w/in 14 days of release.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
- Defendant must set up a Preserve the Peace to gather belongings from residence.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Coreena D. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 500 block of Northport Dr, except while riding on a city bus and only while riding on a city bus. The defendant is prohibited from leaving the bus on the 500 block of Northport Dr. 
Trial Judge - Br 12
